text: Picotamide is a platelet aggregation inhibitor. It works as a thromboxane synthase inhibitor and a thromboxane receptor inhibitor, the latter by modifying cellular responses to activation of the thromboxane receptor. Picotamide is licensed in Italy for the treatment of clinical arterial thrombosis and peripheral artery disease. ==References== ==External links== * Andrea Celestini and Francesco Violi: A review of picotamide in the reduction of cardiovascular events in diabetic patients (PubMed) Category:Antiplatelet drugs Category:Pyridines Category:Benzamides Category:Phenol ethers
